readability_reflection: I considered string concatenation to be more readable than interpolation, because I'm more familiar with concatenation. For example, file navigation was easier to differentiate what was a literal and what was a string variable.
comprehension_debugging: Yes, I'm not used to string interpolation so I often had to stop and deduce the code or values that would be substituted in interpolation.
preference_rationale: I would choose concatenation as I'm more familiar and used to using it.
learning_curve: It greatly affected my understanding as I had virtually no familiarity with string interpolation and have been using concatenation exclusively in C++ for the past couple of years.
suggestions_improvement: Having literals and string variables spaced out typically makes it easier to read.
